alert.note: Alert for Hays; Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 26 at 12:52PM CDT until October 26 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Hays County in south central Texas... Southeastern Travis County in south central Texas... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 1252 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Austin, San Marcos, Kyle, Buda, Wimberley, Austin Bergstrom Int Airport, Uhland, Mustang Ridge, Niederwald, Onion Creek, Manchaca, Mountain City, San Leanna, Hays, Creedmoor, Maha, McKinney Falls State Park, Pilot Knob, Redwood and Del Valle. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
